audio_description: Hello Fans, today I will teach you how to make Hyderabadi-style Chicken Dum Biryani. This biryani is extremely tasty to eat, and after today, you’ll be able to make it easily at home because I’m going to show you a very simple method.

audio_description: First of all, I have taken 1.3 kilograms of chicken here. Wash the chicken thoroughly. After washing, put it into the same vessel in which you’re going to make the biryani. Now we have to marinate the chicken.

audio_description: After that, add some Kashmiri red chili powder — I’ve added one and a half tablespoons here. This will make the biryani spicy and give it a nice color. Then add a little turmeric powder as well.

audio_description: Along with this, we’ll add some brown onions, also called birista. If you don’t know how to make brown onions, there’s a video on the channel. You can watch and learn how to make them. Also, add 5–6 green chilies.

audio_description: Add one tablespoon of garam masala powder or biryani masala powder. Now add some mint leaves — wash them well. Also add some finely chopped fresh coriander. Along with this, add some ginger-garlic paste.

audio_description: Then reduce the flame to medium-low. As you can see, steam has formed nicely inside the biryani and the foil paper has started to puff up. This is the kind of flame you need. And always use a tawa (griddle) below if possible.

audio_description: Now remove the foil paper. In 20 minutes, the chicken cooks completely, especially if you’ve used medium-sized pieces — they cook even faster. Now sprinkle a little mace powder on top for an excellent aroma.

audio_description: And finally, garnish with some finely chopped fresh coriander leaves. This adds great flavor and freshness to the biryani.

audio_description: Now start serving the rice like this. Whenever you scoop out biryani, do it from the sides. Don’t dig from the center, or the rice will break. This is how you properly serve biryani.
